While I was staying there,

With his feet dusty, tired,

He approached me,

Seeing him,
I invited him to sit down;
I asked about his comfort and welfare,
and spoke this statement:
“Whatever is my gift,
all has been given away by me;
Please allow me, brahmin,
I do not have five hundred (cows).”
“If you, sir,

On the seventh day your head
will split into seven pieces.”
The deceitful one, having made his plan,
made a terrible noise;
Having heard his words,
Bāvari was distressed.
He became emaciated from lack of food,
afflicted with the dart of sorrow;
Then his mind,
did not delight in meditation.
Seeing him frightened and suffering,
a deity who wished for his welfare,
approaching Bāvari,
spoke this statement:
“He does not know about the head,
that deceitful one who seeks wealth;
In the head or in the fall of the head,
his knowledge does not exist.”
“You must know about this, madam,

About the head and the fall of the head,
we will listen to your words.”
“I do not know this,

In the head and in the fall of the head,
the Victorious Ones have insight here.”
“Then who does know about this,

About the head and the fall of the head,
